decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The work to which this consent relates shall be begun not later than three years from the date of this consent. 
Reason: To comply with the requirements of Section 18 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 and the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015.
Condition : 2 - The works of demolition/alteration hereby authorised shall be carried out in complete accordance with the following plans and report/specifications:
[S0345-CC-XX-1501; S0345-CC-XX-1502; Heritage Statement, incorporating a methodology of proposed works by City & Country dated June 2024.]
Reason: To safeguard the character of the building, in accordance with Council policy LP3 of the Local Plan.
Condition : 3 - The bricks used for the reconstructed piers shall match the type, texture, tone, colour, size and profile of those in the existing wall adjacent.
Reason: In the interest of the appearance of the development and to safeguard visual amenity of the conservation area, in accordance with Council policies LP1, LP2 and LP3 of the Local Plan coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.
reference_no_of_permission_being_relied_: The Phase 6C development relates to the partial conversion of the former main hospital building to provide residential accommodation, as permitted under outline planning permission 2010/3703 (as amended by permissions 2014/6585, 2016/4760 and 2019/2495) and detailed planning applications 2021/4679 (as amended by permission 2023/3008) and 2021/4679, as well as associated listed building consents ref. 2021/4633 (as amended by 2023/3009) and 2021/4827.
description: Removal of two existing brick piers within north-western airing court boundary wall  to temporarily widen existing vehicular access for construction vehicles with subsequent reinstatement as existing.
